messages.content: You are DocIntel, a medical document analysis AI. Extract structured information from clinical documents. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema. Include diagnoses with ICD-10 codes, medications, procedures, lab results, and follow-up recommendations.

Analyze this medical document and extract structured information:

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Department: Pulmonology
Attending: Dr. Miller
Admission Date: 2023-03-22
Discharge Date: 2023-03-27

Patient is a 89-year-old female admitted for evaluation and management of Acute Upper Respiratory Infection. She presented with symptoms consistent with acute upper respiratory infection and was admitted for further workup.

DIAGNOSES:
Acute Upper Respiratory Infection

HOSPITAL COURSE:
The patient was admitted and started on appropriate therapy. She underwent the following evaluations:
  - Cardiac catheterization: No intracranial hemorrhage or mass effect
  - Thoracentesis: Moderate degenerative changes noted
  - CT Angiography of chest: Significant findings requiring further evaluation

LABORATORY RESULTS:
  - White Blood Cell Count: 4.9 x10^3/uL (normal)
  - TSH: 0.3 mIU/L (low)
  - Platelet Count: 50 x10^3/uL (critical)
  - Chloride: 98.7 mEq/L (normal)

MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE:
  - Metoprolol Succinate 50mg once daily (oral)
  - Metformin 1000mg twice daily (oral)
  - Pantoprazole 40mg once daily (IV)
  - Ciprofloxacin 500mg twice daily (oral)
  - Prednisone 40mg once daily (oral)
  - Amoxicillin 500mg three times daily (oral)
  - Sertraline 50mg once daily (oral)

FOLLOW-UP PLAN:
  - Medication adjustment follow-up with Nephrology in 6 months
  - Repeat lab work with Orthopedics in 1 week
  - Diet and lifestyle counseling with Cardiology in 2 weeks

The patient was discharged in stable condition after a 5-day stay. She was counseled on medication compliance and return precautions.

Return JSON with: document_type, patient_info, diagnoses (with ICD-10 codes), medications, procedures, lab_results, follow_up, and summary.

REFERRAL
From: Dr. Williams (Primary Care)
To: Dr. Smith (Neurology)
Date: 2025-01-03

RE: 68-year-old female

Dear Dr. Smith,

I am referring this 68-year-old female patient for further evaluation and management of Pulmonary Embolism. She has a history of Pulmonary Embolism (ICD-10: I26.99). Current medications and recent lab work are enclosed. Please evaluate and advise on treatment plan.

Thank you for your consultation.
Sincerely,
Dr. Williams

You are DocIntel, a medical document analysis AI. Extract structured information from clinical documents. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema. Include diagnoses with ICD-10 codes, medications, procedures, lab results, and follow-up recommendations.

Analyze this medical document and extract structured information:

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Department: Oncology
Attending: Dr. Rodriguez
Admission Date: 2023-12-16
Discharge Date: 2023-12-19

Patient is a 86-year-old male admitted for evaluation and management of Deep Vein Thrombosis. He presented with symptoms consistent with deep vein thrombosis and was admitted for further workup.

DIAGNOSES:
Deep Vein Thrombosis

HOSPITAL COURSE:
The patient was admitted and started on appropriate therapy. He underwent the following evaluations:
  - CT scan of chest with contrast: Moderate degenerative changes noted

LABORATORY RESULTS:
  - CRP: 6.6 mg/L (normal)
  - Glucose: 167.3 mg/dL (critical)
  - BNP: 55 pg/mL (normal)
  - INR: 1.0 ratio (normal)
  - TSH: 4.4 mIU/L (high)
  - Hemoglobin: 19.8 g/dL (high)
  - HbA1c: 5.4 % (normal)

MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE:
  - Metoprolol Succinate 25mg once daily (oral)
  - Atorvastatin 20mg once daily at bedtime (oral)
  - Albuterol 2 puffs every 4-6 hours as needed (inhaled)
  - Enoxaparin 40mg once daily (subcutaneous)

FOLLOW-UP PLAN:
  - Follow-up with primary care physician with Pulmonology in 2 months

The patient was discharged in stable condition after a 3-day stay. He was counseled on medication compliance and return precautions.

Analyze this medical document and extract structured information:

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Department: Endocrinology
Attending: Dr. Davis
Admission Date: 2022-02-18
Discharge Date: 2022-02-22

Patient is a 76-year-old female admitted for evaluation and management of Acute Myocardial Infarction. She presented with symptoms consistent with acute myocardial infarction and was admitted for further workup.

DIAGNOSES:
Acute Myocardial Infarction, Asthma, moderate persistent

HOSPITAL COURSE:
The patient was admitted and started on appropriate therapy. She underwent the following evaluations:
  - Appendectomy: Results within normal limits
  - Thoracentesis: Findings consistent with clinical diagnosis

LABORATORY RESULTS:
  - INR: 0.8 ratio (normal)
  - TSH: 0.3 mIU/L (low)
  - AST: 39.5 U/L (normal)
  - D-Dimer: 298 ng/mL (normal)
  - HbA1c: 5.3 % (normal)

MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE:
  - Gabapentin 300mg three times daily (oral)
  - Lisinopril 10mg once daily (oral)
  - Sertraline 50mg once daily (oral)
  - Aspirin 81mg once daily (oral)

FOLLOW-UP PLAN:
  - Post-operative follow-up with Oncology in 1 week
  - Pulmonary function testing with Nephrology in 1 month
  - Post-operative follow-up with Psychiatry in 2 weeks

The patient was discharged in stable condition after a 4-day stay. She was counseled on medication compliance and return precautions.
